ARABIC: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِٱلْأُنثَىٰ ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When one of them is given the good news of a baby girl, his face darkens and he is furious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet when news of the birth of a daughter reaches one of them, his face is darkened, and he is overwhelmed with silent grief,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When any of them is told about the birth of a female his face turns dark, and he is filled with suppressed anger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When the glad news of the birth of their daughter is brought to them, their faces turn gloomy and black with anger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when one among of them receives the glad tidings of a daughter, his face turns black for the day, and he remains seething.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when the news of (the birth of) a female (child) is brought to any of them, his face becomes dark, and he is filled with inner grief!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when a daughter is announced to one of them his face becomes black and he is full of wrath.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and when any of them is given the good tidings of a girl, his face is darkened and he chokes inwardly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When if one of them receiveth tidings of the birth of a female, his face remaineth darkened, and he is wroth inwardly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When the birth of a girl is announced to any of them, his face darkens and he is filled with gloom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when there is announced unto any of them a female his countenance remainoth darkened the whole day and he is wroth inwardly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When one of them is brought the news of a female [newborn], his face becomes darkened, and he chokes with suppressed agony.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When news is brought to one of them, of (the birth of) a female (child), his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when the news of (the birth of) a female (child) is brought to any of them, his face becomes dark, and he is filled with inward grief!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When good news of the birth of a female is given to any of them, his face grows dark and inwardly he chokes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And when one of them is given news of a female infant, his face darkens, and he chokes with grief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:58] And when one of them is given the tidings of a girl, that will be born to him, his face becomes darkened, transformed like that of one [suddenly] struck by grief, and he chokes inwardly, filled with anguish: so how is it that daughters are attributed to Him, exalted be He?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When if one of them receiveth tidings of the birth of a female, his face remaineth darkened) with grief, (and he is wroth inwardly) grief stricken and is inwardly devastated.
